meta.name: Weekly Rehab + Half-Marathon Base Plan
meta.notes: 6 workouts (Tuesday-Sunday) tailored for right hip flexor rehab, right ankle stability, posture-related shoulder pain, and low-back spondylolisthesis precautions.

workouts.title: Easy Run and Prehab
workouts.description: Day 1 (Tuesday): easy aerobic run with hip, ankle, and cooldown support.

exercises.name: Dynamic Warm-Up Walk
instructions: Start with brisk walking and relaxed arm swing.
Keep posture tall with ribs stacked over pelvis.
Add gentle marching and ankle circles while moving.
Avoid sudden speed changes in the first minutes.

exercises.name: Easy Conversation Run
instructions: Run at conversational pace where breathing stays controlled.
Take short, quick steps and avoid overstriding.
Keep hips level and trunk steady to reduce hip flexor load.
Switch to run-walk if pain exceeds 3/10.

exercises.name: Band Ankle Eversion
instructions: Sit with band around forefoot and anchor the other end inward.
Turn foot outward against band slowly and with control.
Keep knee still and movement isolated to ankle.
Use light resistance with no sharp pain.

exercises.name: Hip Flexor Isometric Lift-Off
instructions: Stand tall and lift one knee to a pain-free height.
Hold 2-3 seconds while bracing core gently.
Keep pelvis level and avoid trunk leaning.
Stop if deep groin pain or pinching appears.

exercises.name: Cooldown Walk and Breathing
instructions: Walk slowly to bring heart rate down gradually.
Inhale through nose and exhale longer than inhale.
Keep shoulders relaxed and jaw unclenched.
Finish feeling recovered, not abruptly stopped.

workouts.title: Strength Foundation A
workouts.description: Day 2 (Wednesday): full-body strength with low-back-safe bracing.

exercises.name: Goblet Squat to Bench
instructions: Hold dumbbell at chest and stand shoulder-width.
Sit back to bench with controlled descent.
Drive through full foot to stand without spinal extension.
Stay in pain-free depth for hip and back.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Floor Press (Neutral Grip)
instructions: Lie on floor with knees bent and dumbbells neutral grip.
Lower until triceps touch floor lightly, then press.
Keep shoulder blades gently set and neck relaxed.
Do not flare elbows aggressively.

exercises.name: Chest-Supported Dumbbell Row
instructions: Set bench incline and support chest to unload low back.
Row elbows toward hips while keeping shoulders down.
Pause briefly at top and lower with control.
Avoid shrugging or neck jutting forward.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlift
instructions: Hold dumbbells close and hinge at hips with soft knees.
Keep spine neutral and ribs stacked over pelvis.
Stand by squeezing glutes, not arching low back.
Stop before range causes back rounding.

exercises.name: Pallof Press
instructions: Anchor band at chest height and stand side-on.
Press hands forward while resisting trunk rotation.
Keep glutes and abs lightly braced.
Use smooth tempo and no twisting.

exercises.name: Side Plank (Knees if Needed)
instructions: Place elbow under shoulder and align head to knees/feet.
Lift hips and hold steady breathing.
Keep shoulder away from ear.
Use knee-supported version when form slips.

workouts.title: Mobility and Stability Reset
workouts.description: Day 3 (Thursday): recovery cardio, posture work, and joint stability.

exercises.name: Brisk Walk or Easy Bike
instructions: Move at low-to-moderate effort and breathe comfortably.
Keep rhythm smooth and avoid intensity spikes.
Maintain tall posture with relaxed shoulders.
This should feel restorative, not draining.

exercises.name: Single-Leg Balance with Reach
instructions: Stand on one leg with slight knee bend.
Reach opposite foot forward and slightly diagonal.
Keep knee aligned over toes and control ankle wobble.
Use wall support if needed for quality reps.

exercises.name: Calf Raise plus Tibialis Raise
instructions: Perform slow calf raises through full controlled range.
Then lift forefoot/toes for tibialis raises against wall.
Keep movement deliberate and avoid bouncing.
Stop short of cramping or tendon irritation.

exercises.name: Wall Slide with Chin Tuck
instructions: Stand with back against wall and slight chin tuck.
Slide forearms upward while keeping ribs down.
Move only in pain-free shoulder range.
Focus on upper-back activation, not neck tension.

exercises.name: Bird Dog
instructions: Start on hands and knees with neutral spine.
Extend opposite arm and leg without rotating hips.
Pause briefly, then return with control.
Keep low back stable and avoid sagging.

workouts.title: Run-Walk Intervals
workouts.description: Day 4 (Friday): controlled interval session for half-marathon base.

exercises.name: Warm-Up Walk to Easy Jog
instructions: Begin walking, then gradually transition to very easy jog.
Keep cadence light and posture tall.
Prime ankles and hips with smooth relaxed steps.
Do not start intervals until fully warm.

exercises.name: Run Interval 1
instructions: Run at steady easy-moderate effort.
Use short stride and maintain hip stability.
Relax shoulders and keep jaw unclenched.
Back off if pain or form breakdown starts.

exercises.name: Walk Recovery 1
instructions: Walk briskly to recover breathing.
Keep movement smooth and upright.
Reset technique cues for the next interval.
Avoid standing still.

exercises.name: Run Interval 2
instructions: Repeat the same controlled pace as interval 1.
Land softly under center of mass.
Maintain steady arm swing close to torso.
Reduce speed if hip flexor discomfort rises.

exercises.name: Walk Recovery 2
instructions: Walk with purpose and deep controlled breathing.
Keep shoulders low and relaxed.
Let heart rate come down before next run.
Stay consistent rather than rushing.

exercises.name: Run Interval 3
instructions: Run smooth and controlled, not all-out.
Keep trunk quiet and steps quick.
Aim for even effort from start to finish.
If symptoms flare, convert to brisk walk.

exercises.name: Walk Recovery 3
instructions: Walk and recover before cooldown.
Allow breathing to normalize.
Keep body tall and relaxed.
Use this as transition into cooldown.

exercises.name: Cooldown Walk
instructions: Walk easy and lower effort gradually.
Use long exhales to calm the system.
Finish with no abrupt stop.
Note any pain points for next session planning.

workouts.title: Strength Foundation B
workouts.description: Day 5 (Saturday): muscle-focused strength with posture and core emphasis.

exercises.name: Low Box Step-Up
instructions: Use a step height you can control without hip pinch.
Drive through full front foot to stand.
Descend slowly and keep knee aligned over toes.
Hold support lightly if ankle feels unstable.

exercises.name: Incline Push-Up
instructions: Hands on bench or counter, body in straight line.
Lower chest between hands with elbows at 30-45 degrees.
Press up while keeping neck neutral.
Adjust incline to stay pain free in shoulder.

exercises.name: One-Arm Dumbbell Row
instructions: Support one hand on bench and brace core.
Pull elbow toward hip without trunk rotation.
Control the lowering phase.
Avoid upper-trap shrugging.

exercises.name: Supported Split Squat
instructions: Use wall or chair support for balance.
Drop straight down in a pain-free range.
Keep front knee stacked over foot and pelvis level.
Limit depth if hip flexor feels irritated.

exercises.name: Band Pull-Apart
instructions: Hold band at shoulder height with soft elbows.
Pull apart by squeezing shoulder blades together.
Keep ribs down and neck long.
Use lighter band if movement causes neck pain.

exercises.name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on back with knees and hips at 90 degrees.
Press low back gently into floor before each rep.
Extend opposite arm and leg slowly.
Stop if low back lifts off floor.

workouts.title: Long Easy Run Progression
workouts.description: Day 6 (Sunday): longer aerobic session for half-marathon preparation.

exercises.name: Dynamic Warm-Up Walk
instructions: Walk briskly and gradually increase cadence.
Keep posture tall and core lightly engaged.
Add gentle hip circles and ankle mobilization while moving.
Avoid static stretching before the run block.

exercises.name: Long Easy Run or Run-Walk
instructions: Target easy zone effort, not speed.
If needed, use 4 min run and 1 min walk cycles.
Keep stride compact to protect hip flexor and low back.
End early if gait becomes unstable or painful.

exercises.name: Cooldown Walk
instructions: Walk slowly to transition out of effort.
Let breathing settle with long exhales.
Maintain relaxed shoulders and gentle arm swing.
Do not sit immediately after finishing.

exercises.name: Post-Run Mobility (Calf and Hip Flexor)
instructions: Perform gentle calf stretch with heel grounded.
Use half-kneeling hip flexor stretch with glute squeeze.
Keep pelvis neutral and avoid back arching.
Stay in mild stretch range without sharp pain.
